newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - Bunds to crumple if 101.45 support goes.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - Bunds to crumple if 101.45 support goes.

text.p: June Bund futures on LIFFE were clinging onto initial support at 101.45 in early trade on Thursday but face a deeper decline if that level gives way, technical analysts said.
"The only way you'd get dragged through those lows is if the T-bonds do something untoward this afternoon," David Wood, independent technical analyst near London, said.
Bunds were quoted at 101.50 at 0645 GMT, down 0.26 in the session after gapping down to an open of 101.59 from Wednesday's low at 101.67. A holiday in Germany may thin trade.
Wood said support at 101.45 came from the May 2 low.
Wood said if 101.45 did evaporate the contract would head for the 101.14 area, the top of the range from the week of April 17 before the contract shot up.
Analysts at Royal Bank of Scotland in London said in face of light trading volumes over the Ascension Day holiday, value areas will hold trading -- 101.70 to 101.82 above and 101.62 to 101.50 below.

"Bunds are still favoured to dip a little lower to fill the hourly chart gap to 101.21, but the long term bull market is still intact in the channel that comes in today at 100.82 to 102.20," they said in a research note.
Wood said the bottom of the gap at Wednesday's low would likely hold the upside this session.
September Euromarks were quoted at 96.72 at 0705 GMT, unchanged from Wednesday's pit settlement.
Analysts said the resistance at overhead supply at 96.74 continues to dampen trade, making it difficult for the contract to make significant headway.
Initial support comes in at the lows of the last few sessions at 96.72 but a retest of the supports at 96.60 was likely over the next few weeks.
